questions.text: Which one of the following is true regarding uterotonics?

options.label: A
options.text: Oxytocin contracts upper and lower segment of the uterus

options.label: B
options.text: Oxytocin is stored in room temperature

options.label: C
options.text: Carbetocin has longer half-life than oxytocin

options.label: D
options.text: Ergometrine can be used in contraction stress test to detect uteroplacental insufficiency

questions.correct_answer: C. Carbetocin has longer half-life than oxytocin

questions.text: Which one of the following is not correct regarding abortions?

options.label: A
options.text: More pregnancies abort than those which continue till term

options.label: B
options.text: Most common abortion is first trimester abortion

options.label: C
options.text: Most common karyotype of abortus is euploid (50%)

options.label: D
options.text: Most common chromosomal abnormality causing abortion is trisomy

questions.correct_answer: A. More pregnancies abort than those which continue till term

questions.text: A 27 years old primigravida with missed period, her UPT is positive, USG is suggestive of 2 cm gestational sac in left adnexa with no fetal cardiac activity and no free fluid in pouch of Douglas. Her B-HCG is 1289 IU/L. Her pulse is 82/minute and BP is 110/70mm Hg. She is a case of peptic ulcer disease and she is chronic alcoholic. Which one of the following is best for this patient amongst the given options?

A 32 years old primigravida is 6 weeks pregnant with single live intrauterine pregnancy. Her HIV test is positive and her CD4 count is 505 per microlitre. Which of the following is correct about the treatment plan?

options.label: A
options.text: Start tenofovir, lamivudine and dolutegravir irrespective of period of gestation and CD4 count

options.label: B
options.text: Start tenofovir, lamivudine and efavirenz irrespective of period of gestation and CD4 count

options.label: C
options.text: Start tenofovir, lamivudine and dolutegravir after first trimester since dolutegravir causes neural tube defects

options.label: D
options.text: Start tenofovir, lamivudine and efavirenz after 12 weeks for lifetime.

questions.correct_answer: A. Start tenofovir, lamivudine and dolutegravir irrespective of period of gestation and CD4 count

questions.text: Which of the following is correct regarding progesterone? 1: It is used to prevent preterm labour in case of cervical shortening 2: It is used to treat preterm labour 3: It is used as emergency contraceptive 4: It is used to reverse endometrial hyperplasia without atypia
For fetal well-being evaluation in a case of GDM with macrosomia, which of the following test is not useful?
questions.correct_answer: D. USG doppler of umbilical artery

questions.text: A 27 years old G2P1L1 with 31 weeks of gestation, cephalic presentation has had rupture of membranes and she is leaking amniotic fluid since last 2 days. She is febrile. On examination, there is purulent discharge per vaginum with uterine tenderness. Fetal heart rate is 180 per minute. What is the correct line of management in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Give her antibiotics, steroids, MgSO4 and continue pregnancy till 34 weeks

options.label: B
options.text: Give her antibiotics, MgSO4 and deliver immediately

options.label: C
options.text: Give her antibiotics, MgSO4 and continue till 34 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Give her antibiotics and deliver immediately

questions.correct_answer: B. Give her antibiotics, MgSO4 and deliver immediately

questions.text: A 34-year-old primigravida has IUGR with abdominal circumference of the baby of 5th percentile. Her NST is reactive and AFI is 8cm and the baby is in cephalic presentation. She is having 33 weeks of gestation. Her USG doppler was done which showed normal umbilical artery flow. What should be our next plan of action?

options.label: B
options.text: Give steroids and continue till 38 weeks

options.label: C
options.text: Give steroids and do induction of labour immediately

options.label: D
options.text: Give steroids and do LSCS immediately.

questions.correct_answer: B. Give steroids and continue till 38 weeks

questions.text: In acute fatty liver of pregnancy, which one of the following is true?

options.label: A
options.text: It is more common when there is female foetus

options.label: B
options.text: It presents most commonly in first trimester with vomiting

options.label: C
options.text: Pregnancy can be continued till 38 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Hypofibrinogenemia, thrombocytopenia, hypoglycaemia and hepatic encephalopathy are seen

questions.correct_answer: D. Hypofibrinogenemia, thrombocytopenia, hypoglycaemia and hepatic encephalopathy are seen

questions.text: A 27 years old G4P3L3 patient had a full-term vaginal delivery. She developed hypotension and bradycardia after delivery. What is the most likely cause?
A 24 years old patient has 16 weeks of gestation with BP of 180/110mm Hg with urine albumin +4. Her BP was normal before pregnancy. USG is suggestive of snow storm appearance. She is a case of?

A 25-year-old female has invasive mole which is invading the outer half of myometrium. It has not gone beyond that. Her prognostic score is 5. She wants to conserve her fertility for future child bearing function. What is the best plan of action in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Advise her hysterectomy since invasive mole is a cancer

options.label: B
options.text: Give 4 doses of methotrexate therapy and advise her contraception for 1 year after HCG is undetectable

options.label: C
options.text: Give EMACO regimen and advise her contraception for 1 year after HCG is undetectable

questions.correct_answer: B. Give 4 doses of methotrexate therapy and advise her contraception for 1 year after HCG is undetectable

questions.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding the following drug?

options.label: A
options.text: It is most potent uterotonic for prevention of PPH

options.label: B
options.text: Maximum dose which can be given in a day is 2000mcg

options.label: D
options.text: It is never given intra venously

questions.correct_answer: A. It is most potent uterotonic for prevention of PPH

questions.text: Which of the following method of treatment is not suitable for endometrial hyperplasia?

options.label: C
options.text: It has failure rate of 0.01 pearl index

options.text: It is safe in patients with DVT

questions.correct_answer: D. It is safe in patients with DVT

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding endometrial ablation? 1: Second generation ablation technique is done without hysteroscopy 2: It is contraindicated in patient with past history of transmural myomectomy 3: It is done even in post-menopausal patients with bleeding due to endometrial atrophy
A 65 years old post-menopausal patient has bleeding since last 2 months. Her Saline infused sonography revealed FIGO type 1 fibroid of 3 cm. What is the best plan of management in her?

options.label: D
options.text: Endometrial biopsy and if it is normal then no further treatment

Which tests are used in following situations : 1-Compare mean weights between intervention vs placebo group 2-Mean blood sugar levels were compared before and after administering a new drug 3-Association between obesity and diabetes

options.label: A
options.text: 1-Student "t" test , 2- paired t test , 3- Chi square test

options.label: B
options.text: 1-Student "t" test , 2- unpaired t test , 3- Chi square test

options.label: C
options.text: 1-Paired t test , 2- paired t test , 3- Chi square test

questions.correct_answer: A. 1-Student "t" test , 2- paired t test , 3- Chi square test

A test for hepatitis C is performed for 200 patient with biopsy proven disease and 200 patient known to be free of the disease . The test shows positive results on 180 of the patients with the disease , and negative result on 150 of the patient without the disease . Which of the following is true regarding this test :

options.label: A
options.text: Has a positive predictive value of 90 %

questions.text: All are true about p - value except :

options.label: A
options.text: Is the probability of committing Type - I error

options.label: C
options.text: Is the chance that the presence of difference is concluded when actually there is none

options.label: D
options.text: When p- value is less than alpha , the result is statistically significant

questions.correct_answer: B. Is equal t o 1- beta

questions.text: Which of the following is false regarding Pradhan Mantri Surakshit Matritva Abhiyan (PMSMA) :

options.label: A
options.text: The free antenatal checkup will take place on 9th of every month.

options.label: B
options.text: ANC will took place at government and private hospitals and private clinics across the country.

options.label: C
options.text: The scheme is applicable to the pregnant women in either second or third trimester.

options.label: D
options.text: Green sticker on their MCP card indicates high blood pressure.

questions.correct_answer: D. Green sticker on their MCP card indicates high blood pressure.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a primary prevention strategy?
3 tier rural health infrastructure was proposed by :
The specific goals for 2025 under the integrated Global Action Plan for the Prevention and Control of Pneumonia and Diarrhea (GAPPD) are all of the following EXCEPT:

options.label: A
options.text: Reduce mortality from pneumonia in children less than 5 years of age to fewer than 3 per 1000 live births

options.label: B
options.text: Reduce mortality from diarrhea in children less than 5 years of age to fewer than 1 per 1000 live births

options.label: C
options.text: Reduce the incidence of severe pneumonia by 90 % in children less than 5 years of age compared to 2010 levels

options.label: D
options.text: Reduce incidence of severe diarrhea by 75 % in children less than 5 years of age compared to 2010 levels

questions.correct_answer: C. Reduce the incidence of severe pneumonia by 90 % in children less than 5 years of age compared to 2010 levels

options.label: A
options.text: It decreases postoperative nausea and vomiting.

questions.correct_answer: A. It decreases postoperative nausea and vomiting.

questions.text: Nonorganic hearing loss is a decrease in hearing that is unexplained by anatomic or physiologic abnormalities, or both. Choose the most appropriate statement regarding “Non-organic hearing loss”

options.label: A
options.text: Electrocochleography is essential to detect any thresholds.

options.label: B
options.text: The stapedial reflex is seldom of value.

options.label: D
options.text: The Chimani-Moos test is a modification of the Weber test.

questions.correct_answer: D. The Chimani-Moos test is a modification of the Weber test.

questions.text: Choose the most appropriate statement regarding the tonsil shown in the image below

options.label: A
options.text: The crypts are lined by columnar epithelium.

options.label: C
options.text: The tonsillar artery is a branch of the greater palatine.

options.label: D
options.text: The size of the tonsil can be assessed accurately by looking in the mouth while using a tongue depressor.

questions.correct_answer: B. There are no afferent lymphatics.

questions.text: Which of the following statement regarding “Malignant tumours of the nose and paranasal sinuses ” is true:

options.label: A
options.text: Squamous cell carcinoma is the commonest type.

options.label: B
options.text: Retropharyngeal and cervical lymph node metastases are common

options.label: C
options.text: Adenoid cystic carcinoma is associated with woodworkers in the furniture industry.

options.label: D
options.text: An ameloblastoma is a rapidly growing, highly malignant tumour.

questions.correct_answer: A. Squamous cell carcinoma is the commonest type.

An angiogram indicates that several arteries of the gastrointestinal tract are occluded due to atherosclerosis, producing bowel ischemia. Which of the following arteries is most likely occluded in the CT scan:

Brachytherapy: what is/are true? A. Always gives homogenous radiation B. Improve conformality by 3-D techniques C. Useful in carcinoma esophagus D. Same proportion of radiation as teletherapy in localised area E. More effective in Ca Cervix

Which among the following are true regarding Strontium-89 as compared to Phosphorous-32? A. Str-89 is primarily a beta-rays emitter which P-32 is not B. Str-89 has deeper penetration C. Str-89 has a longer T1/2 D. Str-89 is better suited than P-32 for palliation in metastasis E. Str-89 has lesser toxicity
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Recent trials and radiotherapy programmes prefer Str-89 over P-32 because of comparable efficacy and Str-89 having a better side effect profile than P-32 for palliation therapy in metastatic disease. P-32 causes severe myelotoxicity.
  • • Recent trials and radiotherapy programmes prefer Str-89 over P-32 because of comparable efficacy and Str-89 having a better side effect profile than P-32 for palliation therapy in metastatic disease. P-32 causes severe myelotoxicity.

A 4-year-old girl is brought to her pediatrician because her parents think she does not seem to be “developing normally.” The girl’s mother states that her daughter seemed normal for at least the first 2 to 3 years of her life. She was walking and beginning to speak in sentences. She was able to play with her mother and older sister. The mother has been noticing that over the past 2 months her daughter has lost these previously acquired abilities. She will no longer play with anyone else and has stopped speaking entirely. She has lost all bowel control, when previously she had not needed a diaper for at least a year. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

An attractive and well-dressed 22-year-old woman is arrested for prostitution, but on being booked at the jail, she is found to actually be a male. The patient tells the consulting physician that he is a female trapped in a male body and he has felt that way since he was a child. He has been taking female hormones and is attempting to find a surgeon who would remove his male genitals and create a vagina. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Test used for organic brain syndrome is:
A 37-year-old patient with a history of acute intermittent porphyria is scheduled for knee arthroscopy under general anesthesia. Which of the following drugs is contraindicated in this patient?
Which statement is true about ASA grading except?

options.label: A
options.text: Grade 4 is moribund patient who can't survive >24 hours with or without surgery

options.label: C
options.text: ASA grade 2 patient has severe limitation of functional activity

questions.correct_answer: C. ASA grade 2 patient has severe limitation of functional activity

questions.text: An 18-year-old male is posted for an emergency incision and drainage of a neck abscess. The patient was very anxious and therefore the surgeon demanded general anaesthesia for the patient. Since the procedure was short, the anaesthesiologist decided to use succinylcholine and intubate the patient with cuffed endotracheal tube. The patient received 80 mg of succinylcholine for intubation and following the procedure the patient was apneic for over an hour. The patient was shifted to ICU and was kept on controlled ventilation. Which of the following is true about this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: The pseudo cholinesterase gene is likely to be homozygous atypical

options.label: B
options.text: A serum potassium of 2 .5 mmol/L is a possible cause

options.label: D
options.text: The metabolism of lidocaine may well be impaired.

questions.correct_answer: A. The pseudo cholinesterase gene is likely to be homozygous atypical

questions.text: A 29-year-old patient is undergoing a left knee plate removal under general anesthesia with endotracheal tube. At the end of the procedure the patient is extubated. A few moments later you hear high pitched crowing noises from the patient’s airway. The bp is 140\86, hr 92 bpm and o2 saturation is 88 % and dropping. Your initial response would be?

options.label: B
options.text: Suction the airway to remove secretions

options.label: D
options.text: Positive airway pressure with a mask.

questions.correct_answer: D. Positive airway pressure with a mask.

questions.text: The following drugs may be used effectively via a tracheal tube except?
A criminal is presented to court for trial. He has committed an offence under Sec 376 IPC. The correct statement is?

options.label: A
options.text: The burden of proof of sexual intercourse with consent is upon defense

options.label: B
options.text: His medical examination would have been done only upon his consent

options.label: C
options.text: The medical examination of alleged victim happens under CrPC 53 A

options.label: D
options.text: Punishment is more if the victim is an adult

questions.correct_answer: A. The burden of proof of sexual intercourse with consent is upon defense

questions.text: A boy of age 22 commits suicide after failing in love. Upon talking to his family & friends it is known that he was depressed for last many months. This methodology of recreating psychology of dead is called as?

A 100% burnt body comes for post-mortem examination. Body has separation of skin at multiple places, as shown in the picture. The muscles below the separated skin is dark brown in color, dry and hard. The correct statement is ?

options.label: B
options.text: These are ante-mortem wounds with sharp weapon

options.label: C
options.text: These are post-mortem phenomenon due to prolonged burning

questions.correct_answer: C. These are post-mortem phenomenon due to prolonged burning

questions.text: A person is shot dead. The eye witness say that the assailant fired once only. But on autopsy, two bullets are found in the body. This can be due to ?
A worker of match box making factory presents with sinus openings in gums, foul smelling discharge & pain in jaw. The compound responsible for his condition is?

A 32-year-old woman comes to the physician because of vaginal itching and a malodorous discharge that is worse following her menses. She is sexually active with two partners and recently had unprotected sex. Pelvic examination shows erythema of the cervix and malodorous frothy yellow-green discharge present in the cervical os and vaginal vault. Microscopic examination of vaginal secretions shown in the image. Choose the correct infective stage of this pathogen.

A 32-year-old woman who recently emigrated from Wuhan city comes to the emergency department because of severe right upper quadrant pain. An ultrasound of the gallbladder shows high echogenicity and she undergoes a cholecystectomy. Examination of the gallbladder shows a large number of dark-colored, faceted stones with irregular shapes Infection with which of the following organisms is most likely associated with this type of stone'?

A 30-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 3-week history of swollen and painful knees and toes. He also has some low back stiffness that is worse in the morning, and he has been treated recently for conjunctivitis He also describes an onset of urgency, clear urethral discharge and dysuria, which started five weeks ago. He is sexually active and has a monogamous relationship with the same person for the past 2 years. His vitals are normal. Which of the following is most likely to be found in this patient's history?

A 69-year-old woman in a skilled nursing facility develops flulike symptoms. A rapid influenza test is positive. Several days later, she develops a high fever dyspnea a productive cough, and mental status changes. An x-ray of the chest shows a cavitary lesion in her left lung. Sputum specimen is salmon colored. Which of the following pathogen is the most likely causal organism?

A 22-year-old woman comes to the physician because of mild lower abdominal pain and non-malodorous vaginal discharge for the past week. Pelvic examination shows a red swollen cervix without motion tenderness. Examination of the discharge with potassium hydroxide (KOH) is negative, no clue cells under the microscope, and a wet mount does not show motile cells. Gram stain of the discharge shown in the image. Which of the following is the most important factor in the pathogenesis of the most likely causal organism?

A 6-year-old boy with a history of acute lymphoblastic leukemia is brought to the physician by his mother because of a painful rash lasting for the past 3 days. He is currently being treated with chemotherapy. His birth history is significant for his mother having an illness that caused her to develop malaise pruritus and a diffuse rash during her third trimester. Physical examination shows lesions in different stages with some as vesicles on an erythematous base and others as crusted lesions. They are all distributed unilaterally, in a dermatomal distribution. A photograph ofthe rash is shown. Which of the following is most likely responsible for the development of these symptoms in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: A latent infection in the child has been reactivated

options.label: B
options.text: The child has been exposed to a child with chickenpox

options.label: C
options.text: The child has been exposed to a grandparent with shingles

options.label: D
options.text: The rash is a normal side effect of the MMR

questions.correct_answer: A. A latent infection in the child has been reactivated

questions.text: Image shown here is a recently launched vaccine for Rabies. This vaccine belongs to

A 5-year-old child is brought to the emergency department by his parents for right arm pain. The patient reports that he was playing hide and seek outside and felt a sharp pain on his arm while hiding in some thick bushes. His parents suspect that something had stung him. Physical examination shows an edematous and erythematous plaque with mild central pallor. A residual stinger, located central to the lesion, is readily extracted. The physical examination is other wise not significant. Which of the following substances is most likely directly responsible for the skin findings observed in this patient?

A 32-year-old man with AIDS develops a fever, headache and a stiff neck. Examination of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) shows 100 cells, which are mostly lymphocytes, glucose of 35 mg/dL, and protein of 75 mg/dL. Which of the following tests is most likely to confirm this patient's diagnosis

A 67-year-old woman is admitted to the casualty with pyrexia (38.1) and a cough productive of green sputum. The observations show a Pulse rate of 101/min, BP 80/60 and Respiratory rate of 32/min. She is alert and oriented in time and space. Investigations reveal TLC of 21000, Urea of 8.5 and x-ray reveals consolidation in the right lung. She is treated for CAP. A 28-year-old Primi-gravida with 32 weeks pregnancy is brought to the casualty with sudden onset of breathlessness. options.label: A

questions.text: An 84-year-old female was found to have a blood pressure of 85/60 mmHg, heart rate 101beats/min, temperature 37.8°C. Laboratory data are obtained: sodium 137 meq/L, potassium 2.8meq/L, HCO3 10 meq/L, chloride 117 meq/L, BUN 17 mg/dL, creatinine 0.9 mg/dL. An arterial blood gas shows PaO2 80 mmHg, PCO2 24 mmHg, pH 7.29. Her urine analysis is clear and has a Ph of 4.5. What is the acid-base disorder?

options.label: B

questions.correct_answer: C. Normal–anion-gap metabolic acidosis and compensatory respiratory alkalosis

A 46-year-old woman with scleroderma presents with diarrhoea, bloating and weight loss. Colonoscopy is normal with no abnormality found on biopsy histology. options.label: D
options.text: Urine D xylose 5.5 gm in D xylose test.

questions.correct_answer: D. Urine D xylose 5.5 gm in D xylose test.

questions.text: A 23 year old woman presents with 8-month history of bloating, loose stool and bowel-opening frequency of 3 times per day. There is no weight loss. options.label: D
options.text: Symptomatic treatment as she is a case of irritable bowel syndrome.

A 45 year old female presented with pain and swelling in right lower leg for 1 day. She has no medical illness and is not on any medication. On examination her HR is 92/min, BP is 122/76 mm Hg, afebrile, Systemic examination and peripheral pulsation or normal. (WELLS SCORE <1). Her D Dimer came out positive so anticoagulant was started but later on Doppler was negative for DVT. What is the next best step for her?

options.label: B
options.text: Stop anticoagulation and repeat Doppler after 1 week

questions.correct_answer: B. Stop anticoagulation and repeat Doppler after 1 week
